meanings.definition: To attach a new tag or label to something.
meanings.sent1: She retagged her suitcase with her name before the trip.
meanings.sent2: The librarian retagged the books with the correct genres.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat retagged all the toys in the house with its name.
meanings.sent4: The artist retagged the painting with a new title, transforming its meaning.
meanings.sent5: The gardener retagged the plants with colorful labels to make them easier to identify.

meanings.definition: To assign a new tag or label to something.
meanings.sent1: He retagged the boxes in the warehouse for better organization.
meanings.sent2: The store manager retagged the items with updated prices.
meanings.sent3: The students retagged their school supplies with funny nicknames.
meanings.sent4: The scientist retagged the samples, unlocking a new discovery.
meanings.sent5: The chef retagged the ingredients to avoid confusion during cooking.
